Intended Use:
Intended to maintain stable contact between the skin and  the  peritoneal  dialysis  catheter,  and  prevents bacterial  invasion  from  the  outlet.  It  is  embedded subcutaneously at the outlet of the peritoneal dialysis
catheter.
An   active   medical   devices   intended   to   perform peritoneal dialysis.
Intended to remove urinary stones (renal calculi) from the body during an endoscopic procedure.
Intended to support the patient in a seated or reclined posture during haemodialysis procedures.

A cuff that consists of biodegradable porous material containing   collagen,   intended   to   be   embedded
subcutaneously at the outlet of the peritoneal dialysis catheter.
Intended   to  manipulate  the  arteriovenous  shunt  of patients required hemodialysis.
Intended to connect between a dialysis fluid circuit and dialyzer, etc.

Intended  to  filtrates  the  blood  and  separates  the plasma,   and   extracts   specific   substances   in   the plasma  (e.g.,  LDL-cholesterol).  Then,  the  plasma  is passed through the filtration column in the device and the specific substances that are combined with various
substrates are extracted.

Intended   in hemoperfusion   machine to thoroughly remove  the  endogenous  and  exogenous  materials such   as   residual   drugs,   toxins   and   metabolic
substances  in  patients  by  means  of  adsorption  of synthetic resin and extracorporeal blood circulation.

Device Name: Electrical conductivity measuring instrument for dialysis fluid
Intended Use: Intended  to  determine  the  concentration  of  dialysis fluid supplied to a dialyzer based on the measurement of electrical conductivity of dialysis fluid (usually it is electrically measured)

Intended   for   the   visual   examination   of   internal structures  and  treatment  of  the  kidney  (eg:  renal
calcus)  by  inserting  percutaneously  into  the  renal pelvis during nephroscopy.

Intended to clean (incl. rinsing, cleaning, testing and record     keeping     of     process)     and     disinfect haemodialysis  dialyzers  after  each  use  so  that  they
can be reused.
A filter used in the process of haemofiltration, to allow for  the  removal  of  toxins  and/or  the  replacement  of electrolytes.
A    device    used    for    blood    purification    with    a hemodiafilter.

Device Name: Hemodialysis blood tubing/Extracorporeal systems for blood purification
Intended Use: Sterilized   blood   tubing   intended   for   hemodialysis (including hemofiltration and hemodiafiltration).
Hollow fiber filter intended  to  remove  impurities/fluid from the blood of a patient via haemodialysis machine.

A dedicated system designed to support and maintain a  donated  kidney  organ  during  transport  from  the donor to the receiver hospital where the organ will be
transplanted into the recipient.
A  filter  intended  to  be  placed  in  the  urinary  duct  to prevent a renal stone from moving from the kidney into the bladder.

Intended to function as a channel for insertion of the laser   fibre   of   a   laser   beam   guide   (e.g.,   of   a general/multiple      surgical      laser      system)      in nephroscope,  and  for  removal  of  debris  (e.g.,  fluid, calculi   fragments)   when   connected   to   a   vacuum
source.

Intended  to  prepares  dialysis  fluid  for  hemodialysis using an artificial kidney, capable of supplying dialysis
fluid for two or more patients.

Intended to connect (devices of different makers and makes devices compatible with each other) a catheter for   peritoneal   lavage   to   an   external   device   that
manages dialysates.
A  guidewire  used  temporarily  for  correction  of  the position of a peritoneal dialysis catheter.
Intended to heat the dialysate to within on degree, of kidney   patient   who   is   on   continuous   ambulatory peritoneal dialysis (CAPD), body temperature prior to infusion.
intended  for  ultraviolet  irradiation  for  disinfection  of components of peritoneal dialysis transfer tube set.
Intended  to  be  used  with  haemodialysis  to  produce water through reverse osmosis with quality suitable for use with haemodialysis equipment.

Intended   for   visual   examination,   diagnosis,   and treatment  of  the  kidney,  renal  pelvis,  major  calyces, and minor calyces by percutaneously inserting scope
into the renal pelvis.
A set used to suction a thrombus developing inside an arteriovenous     shunt     (external     shunt)     during procedures including hemodialysis.

Device Name: Portable continuous peritoneal perfusate thermal conditioner
Intended Use: A  device  that  heats  the  peritoneal  perfusate  before injection  into  the  peritoneal  cavity.  The  perfusate  is usually  heated  through  direct  contact  of  the  dialysis fluid bag with the radiant heat source.

Device Name:
Citric acid haemodialysis system cleaning
cartridge
Intended Use:
Intended  for  the  in-line  preparation  of  a  citric  acid solution  to  clean/disinfect  the  fluid  pathways  of  the system (remove calcium and magnesium deposits) in
combination with a heat disinfection program.

Intended to be used for the collection of waste fluids during     preparation     and     processing     of     an extracorporeal       circuit       (e.g.,       haemodialysis, haemofiltration,   apheresis,   adsorption   treatment), including the collection and rinsing of ultrafiltrate fluid which may contain blood components.
Intended to remove metabolic waste from the blood to help maintain physiological blood electrolyte and pH levels while haemodialysis is performed

Intended to calibrate conductivity meters used to test the  conductivity  of  dialysate,  dialysate  concentrate,
and water treatment systems used with haemodialysis delivery systems.

Device Name: Haemodialysis dialysate water chlorine test kit/strip
Intended Use: Intended to be used to rapidly indicate, through colour change,  the  concentration  of  total  chlorine  in  water used to prepare dialysate solution for haemodialysis.

Intended to identify air bubbles and/or foam in blood returned to the body [usually through an arteriovenous fistula (AVF)] by the extracorporeal blood circuit of a
haemodialysis system.

Intended  to  mixes  two  concentrates,  A  and  B,  plus
water, to the dialysis solution (dialysate) and monitors the mixture.

Device    intended    to    connect    with         multiple
haemodialysis  systems  in  order  to  aid    monitoring several dialysis treatments simultaneously.

An     electrically-powered     integral     unit     of     a haemodialysis system that allows for the removal of plasma from  the  blood  and  the  infusion of  an  equal amount of plasma replacement solution to the blood.

A microporous device used to capture contamination particles of the dialysate before its instillation into the
peritoneal cavity.

Device Name: Sodium carbonate haemodialysis system cleaning cartridge
Intended Use:
Intended  to  be  connected  to  the  fluid  circuit  of  an institutional   haemodialysis   system   for   the   in-line preparation of  a  sodium  carbonate  solution to  clean the  fluid  pathways  of  the  system  (remove  organic deposits,  fats,  proteins)  in  combination  with  a  heat
disinfection program.

A transfer set is tubing that you use to connect your catheter to the bag of dialysis solution.  It consists of
tubing, connectors etc.
That allows dialysis fluid to enter the abdominal cavity, dwell inside for a while, and then drain back out again

A dialysis catheter is a catheter used for exchanging blood to and from the hemodialysis machine from the patient.  The  dialysis  catheter  contains  two  lumens:
Venous. Arterial
A catheter used for exchanging blood to and from the haemodialysis machine from the patient.

Device Name:
Single Needle Hemodialysis
Catheter/ Blood lines
Intended Use:
The  single-needle  dialysis,  in  which  case  only  one cannula or a single lumen catheter is used to access
the blood.
